{"id":859840834,"question_id":99,"lang":"python3","lang_name":"Python3","time":"2 years, 2 months","timestamp":1671045516,"status":10,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"75 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/859840834/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Recover Binary Search Tree","memory":"14.3 MB","code":"# Definition for a binary tree node.\n# class TreeNode:\n#     def __init__(self, val=0, left=None, right=None):\n#         self.val = val\n#         self.left = left\n#         self.right = right\nclass Solution:\n    def recoverTree(self, root: Optional[TreeNode]) -> None:\n        \"\"\"\n        Do not return anything, modify root in-place instead.\n        \"\"\"\n        self.temp=[]\n        def helper(node):\n            if not node:\n                return\n            helper(node.left)\n            self.temp.append(node)\n            helper(node.right)\n\n        helper(root)\n\n        sor=sorted(n.val for n in self.temp)\n        #print(sor)\n\n        for i in range(len(sor)):\n            self.temp[i].val=sor[i]\n\n\n\n#In this solution we have tried to first store all the nodes into an list and then sorted it according to it's value.\n#Once sorted we are trying to map the values in temp with the sorted one. \n#Watch https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bJBwOMPhe6Y","compare_result":"","title_slug":"recover-binary-search-tree","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1}
